text: Lee Chang-hwan (born 16 March 1982) is a South Korean archer. Lee competed at the 2008 Summer Olympics.Lee Chang-HwanChang-Hwan LEE With a final ranking round score of 669 points, ten points behind leader Juan René Serrano, Lee qualified as the tenth seed for the final competition bracket at the 2008 Summer Olympics in Beijing. He defeated Jiang Lin 112–108 in the first round, then broke the Olympic record by defeating Yusuf Ergin (117–109) in the second round. However, in the third round, Lee and Cheng Chu-sian both reached 105 points, and in the extra round, Lee scored 18 points, while Cheng scored 19 points and eliminated Lee.References Category:Living people Category:1982 births Category:South Korean archers Category:Olympic gold medalists for South Korea
title: Lee Chang-hwan
